intro: Couepia divaricata, commonly known as the variable couepia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, opposite leaves with serrated edges, and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds. Couepia divaricata is often found in dry forests and is adapted to thrive in relatively arid conditions.
